titleInfo.title: In re Sulzer Orthopedics Inc. Hip Prosthesis and Knee Prosthesis Liability Litigation
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum and Order. Sulzer's Motion to enjoin the prosecution in this case (Related Doc # 2797) is GRANTED. Court ORDERS that counsel for the Knights shall immediately transmit a copy of this Order to their clients and the relevant state court; and thereafter submit to this Court a letter confirming compliance with this provision. Signed by Judge Kathleen M. O'Malley on 9/27/2005.(H, C)

titleInfo.title: In re Sulzer Orthopedics Inc. Hip Prosthesis and Knee Prosthesis Liability Litigation
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum and Order. Sulzer's motion for permanent injunctive relief is GRANTED. Jack's motion for permanent injunctive relief 2966 is GRANTED. Kuhn's motion for reconsideration 2970 is DENIED. Kuhn's motions for declaration of rights under Settlement Agreement (Related Doc #'s 2970,3015) are GRANTED to the extent that this Order sets out the limits of permissible discovery in Kuhn's Texas malpractice action. Signed by Judge Kathleen M. O'Malley on 10/18/2005.(H, C)

titleInfo.title: In re Sulzer Orthopedics Inc. Hip Prosthesis and Knee Prosthesis Liability Litigation
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum and Order. The Court earlier issued an opinion granting summary judgment to the defendants in the Moore case. Moore v. Sulzer Orthopedics, Inc., 337 F. Supp. 2d 1002 (N.D. Ohio 2004). Sulzer now seeks dismissal of the Howard and Burgess cases, as well. For the reasons stated herein, Sulzer's request is GRANTED in part; specifically, all of the claims asserted in Howard and Burgess are DISMISSED, except for their claims of negligence per se.The Court will schedule a telephone status hearing to set new discovery and other deadlines. Signed by Judge Kathleen M. O'Malley on 10/3/2006. (H, C)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:01-cv-09000; In re Sulzer Orthopedics Inc. Hip Prosthesis and Knee Prosthesis Liability Litigation;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio
extension.docketText: Memorandum and Order. The Court earlier issued an opinion granting summary judgment to the defendants in the Moore case. Moore v. Sulzer Orthopedics, Inc., 337 F. Supp. 2d 1002 (N.D. Ohio 2004). Sulzer now seeks dismissal of the Howard and Burgess cases, as well. For the reasons stated herein, Sulzer's request is GRANTED in part; specifically, all of the claims asserted in Howard and Burgess are DISMISSED, except for their claims of negligence per se.The Court will schedule a telephone status hearing to set new discovery and other deadlines. Signed by Judge Kathleen M. O'Malley on 10/3/2006. (H, C)

titleInfo.title: In re Sulzer Orthopedics Inc. Hip Prosthesis and Knee Prosthesis Liability Litigation
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum and Order: The Court Orders that the following amounts be paid as additional common benefit awards: Plaintiffs' Liaison Class Counsel shall receive: (1) common benefit attorney fee award of $211,187.50 and (2) a common benefit expense award of $15,896.11; Glenn Zukerman of Weitz&Luxenburg, P.C. shall receive a common benefit attorney fee award of $223,812.00; and the request of Kim West of Wallace, Jordan, Ratliff&Brandt, LLC for a common benefit award is denied. (Related Doc #'s 3778,3281,3283,3284). Signed by Judge Kathleen M. O'Malley on 12/26/06.(S, R)

titleInfo.title: In re Sulzer Orthopedics Inc. Hip Prosthesis and Knee Prosthesis Liability Litigation
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum&Order. Sulzer's motions to show cause why summary judgment should not be entered as to claims remaining (Howard doc # 62; Burgess doc # 15) are DENIED. Sulzer to file motion for summary judgment on or before 28 days from the date of this Order. Plaintiffs to file brief in opposition on or before 56 days from date of this Order. Sulzer may then file a reply brief on or before 70 days from date of this Order. Signed by Judge Kathleen M. O'Malley on 3/23/2007.(H,CM)

titleInfo.title: In re Sulzer Orthopedics Inc. Hip Prosthesis and Knee Prosthesis Liability Litigation
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum and Order. Sulzer's Motion for Order enjoining class member Richard Clements from prosecuting certain settled claims (Related Doc # 3308) is GRANTED. The Court hereby ENJOINS the continued prosecution by plaintiff Richard Clements of the following case or any other case asserting similar claims: Clements v. Sulzer Orthopedics, case no. BC263905, Los Angeles County Superior Court. The Court ORDERS that counsel for Clements immediately transmit a copy of this Order to Clements and the relevant state court and thereafter submit a letter to this Court confirming compliance with this provision. Signed by Judge Kathleen M. O'Malley on 5/15/2007.(H,CM)
